Which of the following is correct regarding the Lee v. Chemielewski .pdf

Which of the following is correct regarding the Lee v. Chemielewski .pdffashion1231

Which of the following is correct regarding the Lee v. Chemielewski case referenced in the text? Multiple Choice The appellate court held that the trial judge erred in determining that the defendant had failed to accept the settlement offer, and the $14 million jury verdict was reversed. The appellate court held that the trial judge erred in determining that the defendant had failed to accept the settlement offer, and the $14 million jury verdict was affirmed. The appellate court held that the trial judge erred in determining that the defendant had failed to accept the settlement offer, and the case was remanded to the trial court for further proceedings. The appellate court held that the trial judge was correct in determining that the defendant had failed to accept the settlement offer and granted a judgment notwithstanding the verdict. The appellate court held that the trial judge was correct in determining that the defendant had failed to accept the settlement offer and granted summary judgment Which of the following is correct regarding the Lee v. Chemlelewskicase referenced in the text? Multiple Choice The appeilate court held that the thal judge erred in determining that the defendent had failed to occept the settiement offer, and the $14 million jury verdict was reversed The oppellate court heid that the trial judge erred in dotermining thet the defendant had falled to accept the settiement offer, and the $14 milion jury verdict was affitmed. The appellate court heid that the trial judge ented in determining that the defendant had falled to accept the settlement offer, ond the case was remanded to the trial court for further proceedings The appeliate court held that the tuat judge was correct in determinng that the defendant had faled to accept the setslement offer and granted a judgment notwithistanding the verdict The appeliate court held that the trial judge was correct in determining that the defendant had falled to accept the settlement offer and granted summary judgment.

You are the chief audit executive (CAE) for the internal audit depar.pdf

You are the chief audit executive (CAE) for the internal audit depar.pdffashion1231

You are the chief audit executive (CAE) for the internal audit department of Dig Deep Ltd, a mining equipment manufacturing company, based in Johannesburg. The Chief Audit Executive has constantly received requests from the audit committee for services not covered by the internal audit charter. There is an internal audit charter in place, however, it has not been reviewed for the past seven years. An extract from some of the sections (6, 7,8 and 9) of the internal audit charter reads as follows: 6. Organisation The CAE shall report to the board administratively and functionally to the CEO. 7. Independence and Objectivity The chief audit executive will ensure that the internal audit activity remains free from all conditions that threaten the ability of internal auditors to carry out their responsibilities in an unbiased manner, including matters of audit selection, scope, procedures, frequency, timing, and report content. Internal auditors will have no direct operational responsibility or authority over any of the activities audited. The internal auditors should assist with specific operational responsibilities when requested. 8. Responsibility The Chief Audit Executive and the internal audit staff had the responsibility to: a) Submit annually to senior management and the board a risk-based internal audit plan for notification. b) Ensuring that the internal audit activity collectively possesses or obtains the knowledge, skills and other competencies needed to meet the requirements of the internal audit charter. c) Set the risk appetite for the organisation and review the management of key risks. d) Issuing quarterly reports on the results of the audit activities to management and the audit committee, after approval of the CEO. e) Oversee and monitor managements actions to manage fraud risks. 9. Quality Assurance and Improvement Program The internal audit activity will maintain a quality assurance and improvement program that covers all aspects of the internal audit activity. Approval/Signature REQUIRED Marks Review the internal audit charter above according to the IPPF, identify and explain shortcomings and recommend improvements. Structure your answer in the following format:Identification and explanation of deficiency/shortcoming identifiedRecommendation with reference to the IPPF, where applicable.
